definition: to say hello to/to send one's regards to
to ask
to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to
good/well/proper/good to/easy to/very/so/(suffix indicating completion or readiness)/(of two people) close/on intimate terms/(after a personal pronoun) hello
no matter what may happen (idiom)

sentences.english: Please say hello to your wife.
And when I said hello to cashiers and clerks, I got better service.
sentences.chinese: 当我向出纳员或店员问好时，能得到更优质的服务。

sentences.english: Say hello to Mr. Wang for me.
Please remember me to Dr. King.
Now she and the others say "good morning" when they get into the car.
sentences.chinese: 现在她和其他孩子上车得的时候都会相互问好。

sentences.english: Heidi ran forward to wish good-morning to him and the goats.
sentences.chinese: 海蒂跑上前向他们问好。
请代向史密斯先生问好。

sentences.english: I'm now saying hello to you on the Magic Carpet .
sentences.chinese: 我现在在魔法飞毯上跟你问好。
或者我得说，代你向她问好。

sentences.english: They agreed to say hello to each other every day through QQ, later XuSong crush on music.
sentences.chinese: 他们约定每天通过QQ彼此问好，后来许嵩迷上音乐。

sentences.english: You can stop by to visit your ex-boss and say hi to them or treat them coffee.
sentences.chinese: 可以顺道拜访旧上司，向他问好或请他喝杯咖啡。

sentences.english: This is Grove Lions sayin' hi to you.
sentences.chinese: 这是歌缚梨安，向你问好。

sentences.english: When you meet others first time, you should say "hello" forwardly.
sentences.chinese: 当你与别人初次见面时，你应该主动问好。

sentences.english: Denise came in and said hello to everyone.
sentences.chinese: 丹尼丝进来向每个人问好。

sentences.english: The rude student runs past Mr. Ge without saying 'Hello' to him.
sentences.chinese: 这个粗鲁的学生从葛老师身边跑过，没向他问好。

sentences.english: A: Please say hello to your family.

definition: to greet sb by word or action/to give prior notice
to send one's greetings/to send best regards/to devote attention to
to give one's respects/to send a greeting/(fig.) (coll.) to make offensive reference to (somebody dear to the person to whom one is speaking)
to bow/(literary) to bend down
to salute/to make one's salutations
to pay one's respects/to give regards to
leave-taking/to say goodbye
to call out to/to greet/to say hello to/to inform/to take care of/to take care that one does not
to return a greeting/to send a gift in return
to express thanks
to salute/salute
to return a politeness/to present a gift in return
to shake hands
to pay respects/to wish good health/in Qing times, a specific form of salutation (see also 打千[da3 qian1])
courtesy/manners
to exchange conventional greetings/to talk about the weather
